text:
May 25, 1956
Miss Eleanor Wensberg
Radio Station WAYC
Antioch College
Yellow Springs, Ohio
Dear Miss Wensberg;
In answer to your letter of May 18, we would like to give you informa¬
tion regarding membership in the National Association of Educational
Broadcasters.
The NAEB has three categories of membership, as follows;
Active - Educational institutions, public service organizations,
etc. owning and operating their own radio and/or television stations.
Associate - Institutions (as above) not owning stations, but oper¬
ating production centers and regularly producing programs over a com¬
mercial outlet.
Affiliate - Any organization or individual interested in the gen-
eral furtheranee of educational broadcasting*
For Active members with radio stations, dues in the association are based
on rated transmitter power, as follows;
Class A - 5 kw and over - $50.00
Class B - 1 - U.9 kw - 25.00
Class C - less than 1 kw - 15*00
Television stations with less than 5 kw video power pay $50.00 and
those with 5 kw or more video power pay $100.00.
Associate and Affiliate members pay $10.00 a year. For this fee men*,
bers receive our monthly Newsletter; the various reports and surveys
we publish periodically; services"of our Placement Service , television
engineer, legal counsel, management consultant, etc.; plus the normal
day-to-day services, information, and advice that any national organi¬
zation gives its members. Under separate cover we are sending you
samples of some of the materials we regularly send our members, plus
other items which will give you more information about the Association.
Of course, Associate and Affiliate members do not receive as many of
these materials as regularly as Active members do.
